In Japanese mahjong, each tile is represented by a Unicode character, such as ğŸ€€ for MAHJONG TILE EAST WIND. During each round, players typically have 14 tiles in their hand and must discard one tile per turn to progress towards a Ready Hand, which consists of four melds (a meld is either a sequence or a triplet) and a pair, or 7 pairs. A common strategy is to group the tiles, trying to form a pair, a sequence, or a triplet. Then, attempt to remove groups to reduce the number of groups to 5, as this will yield the maximum number of waiting tiles. You will be given 14 tiles in your hand.
